title: swogerino
author: swogerino
content: I had about 5467 staked ZIL in ATOMIC wallet and now I only see the 148 ZIL I had not staked which were needed to confirm the staking,I know that there is an ongoing upgrade on the ZIL network but where did these coins got?Yesterday Atomic wallet said that all stake,deposit and withdrawal operations were suspended on the ZIL network because of this ongoing upgrade,did something nasty happened to me?I don't think so as I don't see a suspicious transaction nor I am hacked or something like that as I use Linux and my machine is super clean,I have all other cryptos here and they are all here.I hope I have not lost my ZIL,a couple of screen shots below to proof what I am saying.

comments.author: blockman
comments.body: Check your transaction history if something goes off with your ZIL. If there's none to be found then you have nothing to worry about because if you've been hacked or what, then there's nothing left the hacker will allow for you to see. Probably this could just be a glitch since as you've mentioned that ZIL is currently upgrading and the status of your wallet has been affected by it. A version of Atomic update could also be a thing here, check out if they've got some new release and update it but if there's none, then we can conclude that it's just an upgrade matter so wait until it's finished.

comments.author: swogerino
comments.body: Quote from: blockman on May 04, 2023, 10:54:38 PMCheck your transaction history if something goes off with your ZIL. If there's none to be found then you have nothing to worry about because if you've been hacked or what, then there's nothing left the hacker will allow for you to see. Probably this could just be a glitch since as you've mentioned that ZIL is currently upgrading and the status of your wallet has been affected by it. A version of Atomic update could also be a thing here, check out if they've got some new release and update it but if there's none, then we can conclude that it's just an upgrade matter so wait until it's finished.Yes I wrote to Atomic support and they told me that my coins are safe in the blockchain and I checked the link of my ZIL address at stake.zilliqa.com and the coins were there,they advised me to upgrade the wallet also and they pointed out to be an internet connection issue which is not at all a problem,I have a very fast connection at home.Also I am not hacked and if I were the hacker would leave trace as the transaction that he would have taken my money would be there in my wallet in the transactions tab.I will upgrade the wallet today and see if there is anymore problems but the good thing is my coins are safe.In Linux we are usually much safer than in Windows regarding hacking although lately a lot of malware is attacking Linux devices also.
